application.name: cnetnewradii
application.brief: Generate new radii from DEM for a ControlNet

description.p: This application will go through an existing ControlNet and copy it to a new one. When it encounters a PointType Fixed it will give the latitude and longitude to a Universal Ground Map that is generated from the DEM and ask it for a value back. The Radius of that ControlPoint is updated with the DN value recieved from the DEM.

If, for a particular point, the application fails to set the Univeral Ground or if the Radius calculated using the DEM returns Null (or any other special pixel value), then the input Radius value is kept and the point is set to Ignore=true. The number of these failures are recorded in the application's log. The Point IDs for the corresponding control points will be listed in the ERRORS log output file. If the user did not enter a filename for this log and there are any points that failed, one will be created with the name "failures.log". Note: If a significant number of fixed points in the ControlNet fail to find a new Radius value, the user should make sure that they have input the correct DEM for the network.

history.change: Modified to handle control points that fail to calculate a new radius as explained in the description. Added ERRORS parameter to list PointIDs of the control points that failed to calculate a new radius. Added filters for input and output parameters.
Altered to compile with the new Control redesign.
Updated to not try to project null lat,lon values
Updated for Control Point's removal of Set/GetSurfacePoint() and added the GetLatLon parameter.
Changed the DEM parameter name to MODEL

parameter.name: CNET
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the input ControlNet to generate the output from.

parameter.name: MODEL
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the DEM to use with the original ControlNet.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: Use this parameter to specify the name of the output ControlNet.

parameter.name: ERRORS
parameter.description: This file will contain the Point IDs of all control points whose radius could not be calculated from the DEM. This happens when the radius value is a special pixel or when the program fails to set universal ground given the lat/lon values of the control point.

parameter.name: NETWORKID
parameter.description: The user must specify the Network Id for the ouput ControlNet

parameter.name: GETLATLON
parameter.brief: The lat/lon used to set the new radii
parameter.description: Specify the Surface Point to use when setting the new radii.

option.description: Use the lat/lon values provided by the Apriori Surface Point when setting the new radii.
Use the lat/lon values provided by the Adjusted Surface Point when setting the new radii. The lat/lon value of the Adjusted Surface Point is generated by bundle adjust.
